channel.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
channel.description:
https://imgur.com/a/kgpXtXA
**(click on image above to see all 3 screenshots)**
In this legendary game, an Aristocrat uses Noble Twin TWICE to carry Unseen to victory.
He could not use Political Pressure because it was Hunter and GK left, and you can't target King with Political Pressure. (edit: as nuclearburrito explained, PP could have achieved the same effect)
I have changed my mind about removing Noble Twin from Noble.
What about you, @NuclearBurrito ?

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Scout spy is an even greater risk for these kinds of plays at the point in the game where this matters.

I’ve seen the old targeted spy catch far more evils doing these kinds of plays compared to global spy who I have yet to see catch scum this way.

And I have seen evils cooperating so it isn’t scaring off all the scum from trying. I’ve done plays involving whispers semi-reguarly and all I need to do in order to counter maid spy is wait a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
It too heavily discourages scum (neutrals and kings included) from conspiring during the day. If an evil scumreads someone so well that they correctly identify them as another evil (like Assassin and Evil King, or Sorcerer and Mastermind, or Fool and Neutral Killer) they should be encouraged to conspire with each other.

At the moment, they are heavily discouraged by the enormous risk of global spy.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Why? What problem does removing it solve?

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Then nope I don’t lol, basically I want to get rid of Global Spy regardless of what it is replaced with.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Then you do not support my version. Because it is explisitly not designed to replace global spy

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Okay well that’s obviously a different definition than the one I was using. I would support your version as long as we get rid of Global Spy.

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Scout spy’s by definition remain active until at earliest the person being spyed on dies.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Are we talking about the same kind of Scout Spy? Because when I say Scout Spy I have in mind a limited use night ability that is controlled during the day like Sheriff scout, not a permanently active scout spy.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
No because they do NOT have the same potential. Their differences do not just effect the odds of seeing any given whisper but also effect which combination of whispers can be seen at all.

What I said about global whisper seeing multiple groups applies but also scout spy keeping tabs on a key figure for the entire game. Both of these use cases are unique to each tipe of spy. Therefore they do not have the same potential

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Ignoring the part about how it affects the meta, none of what you’ve said proves or implies in anyway that scout spy requires less skill than global spy. In fact it is impossible to disprove that scout spy (if it can be used the same number of days as global spy) requires more skill because of the simple fact that both spies have the exact same potential but fulfilling this potential is more difficult with the scout form.

Scout Spy requires more skill than Global Spy.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I’m not. Like I said scum have the most reason to whisper late game before factoring in spy. Making it harder for BD to have a spy on someone late game is thus better if that isn’t how we want it used.

And if that isn’t how it is being used then we need an alternative use which global spy provides. If whisper meta is not in play and people are whispering in small groups rather than in one large group then global spy can gather information from all of these groups at once and keep everyone information and cross reference information between groups.

These are all good things that justify global spy over scout spy.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Scout Spy:
Discourages enemy whispers late game
Is a non issue early game
Is better when less people are being whispered to

Global Spy:
Discourages enemy whispers early game
Is a non issue late game
Is better when more people are being listened to

Therefore:

Global Spy on Noble encourages meta’s that we want and Scout spy discourages it and vice versa for Aristocrat

Alright so what I’m reading is that Scout Spy is objectively better in every way except for the fact that tweaking the meta in a positive direction is better done through the worse ability

Alright fine

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)

item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Scout spy needs the who and Global Spy needs the when.

aka one needs you to be good at the game and the other is just timing lol

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
False. Global spy requires the same amount of decision making as Global Spy and has just as much potential for baiting.

The difference between Global Spy and Scout spy is what you need to know/guess to see the whisper: Scout spy needs the who and Global Spy needs the when.

Take a game in which the Sorcerer finds the assassin D5. If the Noble is randomly picking day’s between 1-8 to spy on then the odds of seeing it are 1/4. If the assassin was the only missed kill then at the same time the odds for scout spy are also exactly 1/4. The more killes the higher the odds for scout spy and the later the game the less likely a global spy am be to see you.

However there are some other factors:

1: If someone is whispering constantly then a scout spy can catch all of it while a Global Spy cannot

2: If multiple Groups are whispering at the same time then a global spy is the only way to get all of that information

3: BD wants the Noble to see their whispers while they want the Aristocrat not to

4: Scum are more likely to whisper something suspicious late game (D5+)

5: We care more about how these ability’s effect BD than Scum

This means that-

Scout Spy:
Discourages enemy whispers late game
Is a non issue early game
Is better when less people are being whispered to

Global Spy:
Discourages enemy whispers early game
Is a non issue late game
Is better when more people are being listened to

Therefore:

Global Spy on Noble encourages meta’s that we want and Scout spy discourages it and vice versa for Aristocrat

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
The maximum number of whispers Scout Spy can expose to the Noble is exactly the same as Global Spy, but reaching this maximum requires luck, continuous input and choices while Global Spy requires none of that.

Global Spy and Scout Spy can both be prevented but once active, only Scout Spy can be proactively countered (e.g. baiting the scout to take it off a more important whisper) in a loose sense. Technically you can lie in whispers to counter both, but again, Scout Spy allows for more strategy.

It has a higher skill ceiling.

Read full topic

item.title: Noble Twin FTW! (SCREENSHOTS)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The second statement does not follow from the first and both of them require you to prove it rather than just asserting that it is true

Read full topic
